Ulf,

Yes, you are right. It works fine from Matlab and Python, but not C++=
.  
This was an oversight when I made changes to C++ class IdealGasMix. For=
  
now, a work-around is to first go into Python or Matlab and create the  =

object:

 >> gas =3D IdealGasMix('mech.inp')

This will create file mech.x=
ml as a byproduct that you can then use in  
your C++ code. Alternatively, =
from the command line, use the ck2ctml  
utility first:

% ck2ctml -i mech.=
inp -o mech.xml -t therm.dat -tr tran.dat

I will fix this problem in Ideal=
GasMix soon.

By the way, I am working on a new preprocessor that will make=
 it very  
easy to write reaction mechanisms and automatically generate the=
 XML  
file Cantera needs.  This will work for multiphase surface reaction =
 
mechanisms too. The user input will be not much more verbose than a  
Che=
mkin file. There will also be a converter from Chemkin format to  
this new=
 'kinder, gentler' Cantera format.

Dave Goodwin



On Monday, July 7, 2003=
, at 08:34 AM, usenechal wrote:

> Dear Professor,
>
> I'm using the c++ ve=
rsion of cantera 1.4 and cannot use chemkin-
> format files with IdealGasMi=
x-Functions, like this:
>
> gas =3D new IdealGasMix("gri30.inp");
>
> I get=
 an error from the "find_XML"-procedure. I couldn't find an
> example using=
 an chemkin-file as parameter to idealgasmix, so is this
> behavior normal =
or should it work ? It worked in version 1.2 and 1.3
> but maybe things hav=
e changed ... and I have to use some import-and-
> convert procedures befor=
e ?
>
> best regards
> Ulf S=E9n=E9chal
